intro: Malvastrum pentandrum, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Malvastrum pentandrum thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower landscapes.
